title: The Sage encyclopedia of classroom management
subject: Classroom management$$QClassroom management -- Encyclopedias
Classes (Éducation) -- Conduite$$QClasses (Éducation) -- Conduite -- Encyclopédies
EDUCATION -- Administration -- General
EDUCATION -- Organizations & Institutions
Classroom management
publisher: Thousand Oaks, California : SAGE Publications, Inc.
description: A teacher's ability to manage the classroom strongly influences the quality of teaching and learning that can be accomplished. Among the most pressing concerns for inexperienced teachers is classroom management, a concern of equal importance to the general public in light of behavior problems and breakdowns in discipline that grab newspaper headlines. But classroom management is not just about problems and what to do when things go wrong and chaos erupts. It's about how to run a classroom so as to elicit the best from even the most courteous group of students. An array of skills is needed to produce such a learning environment. The SAGE Encyclopedia of Classroom Management raises issues and introduces evidence-based, real-world strategies for creating and maintaining well-managed classrooms where learning thrives. Students studying to become teachers will need to develop their own classroom management strategies consistent with their own philosophies of teaching and learning. It is hoped that this work will help open their eyes to the range of issues and the array of skills they might integrate into their unique teaching styles.
contributor: Scarlett, W. George, editor.$$QScarlett, W. George
contents: Vol 1: Introduction: classroom management-embracing complexity -- a; b; c; d; e; f; g; h; i; j; k; -- Vol 2: l; m; n; o; p; q; r; s; t; u; v; w; z; -- appendix a: classroom management in the united states -- a chronology of key persons, events, and movements -- appendix b: organizations and publications providing resources for classroom management -- index.
relation: $$Cform$$VPrint version: Sage encyclopedia of classroom management$$QSage encyclopedia of classroom management
lds60: Includes appendices: Classroom management in the United States: a chronology of key persons, events, and movements; and Organizations and publications providing resources for classroom management.
